descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Econ 201 is a basic introductory course in economics. The first part of the course will cover general topics such as scarcity, choice, how competitive markets work and how prices are determined. The course will then focus on the study of macroeconomics and cover topics such as economic growth, business cycles, the causes of recessions and unemployment, inflation, financial crises and the roles of monetary and fiscal policy.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two midterms and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
